<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/netflix-announces-better-than-expected-subscriber-growth?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The One True Winner of Squid Game
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/netflix-announces-better-than-expected-subscriber-growth?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The One True Winner of Squid Game" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0d42ee805d3419463b6a69c8b921b324148d9f89-600x399.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Squid Game (Netflix)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s Netflix. The streaming service said it added 4.4 million net subscribers last quarter to top analyst predictions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Compare that to a measly 5.5 million net subscribers for the entire first half of 2021, and it seems Netflix got its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/19/netflix-nflx-q3-2021-earnings.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mojo back</a> after an awkward post-quarantine period.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The star of Netflix’s summer slate?</strong> <em>Squid Game</em>. The gory Korean drama has become Netflix’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-17/squid-game-season-2-series-worth-900-million-to-netflix-so-far?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most popular show</a> by far, with 142 million accounts tuning in within its first four weeks—demolishing runner-up <em>Bridgerton</em>’s lifetime viewership of 82 million by 73%.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><em>Squid Game</em></span> <span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-17/squid-game-season-2-series-worth-900-million-to-netflix-so-far?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly generated</a></span><span> $900 million in value, and it cost only about $21 million to make. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was also the No. 1 show in 94 different countries, showcasing Netflix’s extensive global reach.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix isn’t just looking beyond borders for new customers, but also to different mediums besides TV and movies. Specifically, video games. In yesterday’s shareholder letter, Netflix highlighted that it recently a) acquired video game developer Night School Studio and b) added games to its mobile app in Poland, Spain, and Italy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why?</strong> Because the competition has never been fiercer.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Netflix acknowledged that it competes with a “staggeringly large set of activities for consumers’ time and attention." Netflix said it recorded a 14% engagement boost when Facebook went down for several hours on Oct. 4.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But unrest is lurking beneath the surface. </strong>Some Netflix employees will rally in front of the streamer’s LA headquarters this morning ahead of a planned virtual walkout today. The protest is the crest of a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/19/business/media/netflix-dave-chappelle-employee-walkout.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">building wave</a> of backlash to Dave Chappelle’s standup special <em>The Closer</em>, a Netflix original show that critics say is transphobic.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/the-fda-could-approve-mixing-and-matching-vaccines?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Moderna? Pfizer? FDA Says…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/the-fda-could-approve-mixing-and-matching-vaccines?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gif of people saying that both is good" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=363 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-19/image-1eaa7633584312595bef234cc4c16aaad2abb7ef-296x160-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker(24).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gif of people saying that both is good" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-19/image-1eaa7633584312595bef234cc4c16aaad2abb7ef-296x160-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker(24).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether you were jabbed with Moderna, Pfizer, or another Covid-19 vaccine, you may soon be able to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/oct/19/covid-vaccine-booster-mix-johnson-and-johnson-pfizer-moderna-us?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">switch brands</a> for your booster. The FDA could approve a mix-and-match strategy as early as tonight, when it’s expected to announce its authorization of Moderna and Johnson & Johnson boosters.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meet “heterologous prime-boost”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not a Transformer. It’s the scientific term for receiving two different types of vaccines. The pandemic’s putting this strategy to the test, and so far, the results <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/19/health/covid-vaccine-mix-match.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are promising</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When Europe allowed young people who got AstraZeneca’s vaccine to switch to Pfizer for their second shots, their immune systems produced more antibodies than those who stuck with one type, researchers found.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A recent study of 50 volunteers found that people who received two J&J shots saw their antibodies increase 4x, but those who switched to Pfizer for their boosters got a 35x power-up and a 76x boost from Moderna.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why?</strong> Sparring against two different vaccine formulas may better prepare your immune system to fight the main boss, Covid-19.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Immunity benefits aside, allowing patients to switch boosters could help speed up the distribution of vaccines.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/s-and-p-500-boardrooms-have-gotten-more-diverse-over-the-past-year-studies-show?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boardrooms of the S&P Are Getting More Diverse
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the past year, US public companies have added the most diverse group of new directors ever, according to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/newest-class-of-corporate-directors-is-the-most-diverse-yet-but-gains-are-uneven-11634644801?mod=hp_lead_pos12" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two new studies</a>. Ethnic and racial minorities accounted for 47% of new directors compared to 22% the previous year, according to a study by executive search firm Spencer Stuart.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One-third of new directors added to corporate boards between May 2020 and May 2021 were Black, up from just 11% the year prior.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Both studies show that more than one-third of S&P 500 boards have three female directors, and roughly one-quarter of them have four. Just 10% of boards had four female directors in 2016.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The shifting makeup of boards comes as public companies face regulatory pressure to make their boards look more like America. In August, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nasdaqs-board-diversity-proposal-faces-sec-decision-11628242202?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SEC approved</a> a rule that companies listing on the Nasdaq meet minimum diversity requirements for their boards, or explain why they missed those minimums. And a pair of recent <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-race-and-ethnicity-chris-holden-legislation-racial-injustice-60eab0f0c722c65802050179c23dd3c5?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">California laws</a> also established diversity requirements for public companies based in the state (though one of them is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/appeals-court-revives-challenge-to-california-law-mandating-women-board-members-11624317002?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facing legal challenges</a>).—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

Key Performance Indicators

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/key-performance-indicators-october-20?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A popular tourist photo spot in Old San Juan is seen empty in San Juan, Puerto Rico" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1104603c29b771a447c1cb7763038ff0e7dc9ab0-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>RICARDO ARDUENGO/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The place with the highest percentage of people fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in the US is not a state but a territory—Puerto Rico. 72.2% of the island’s total population is fully vaxxed. Here's a <a href="https://twitter.com/ashishkjha/status/1449789507814010883?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quick thread</a> on how they did it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I have been cool for a long time, but I’m even more cool now.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">80-year-old Martha Stewart <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/martha-stewart-does-nftsjack-o-lantern-art-and-a-seductive-selfie-11634634001?mod=hp_listc_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a collection of NFTs yesterday, including one of her “thirst trap” selfie taken last summer, according to the WSJ.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE CHANGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/seville-will-become-the-first-city-in-the-world-begin-naming-heat-waves?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is It A Heat Wave Or Is It 'Gary'?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/seville-will-become-the-first-city-in-the-world-begin-naming-heat-waves?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Is It A Heat Wave Or Is It 'Gary'?" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/bf14908e38c71af2b8b990e196d37e97e9a9200b-1024x681.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Seville, Spain, will become the first city in the world to begin naming and categorizing heat waves, similar to the system already in place for hurricanes. Kicking off in 2022, the plan is part of an increasing global effort to bring more attention to heat waves as an immediate threat and <a href="https://www.axios.com/record-shattering-heat-waves-becoming-far-more-likely-study-e13fde50-45d8-4bcd-bc86-efecba6c5217.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">symptom of climate change</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Climate experts and public health officials <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/weather/2020/08/06/naming-heat-waves/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have said</a> that naming heat waves could help make an invisible threat like heat more tangible, and allow local authorities to more easily communicate about and plan for them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US isn’t naming heat waves just yet, but the government is taking steps to address the dangerous effects heat has on workers (particularly, those in low-income groups).<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Following the hottest summer <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-sets-a-summer-heat-record-this-year-11631229336?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on record</a>, the Biden administration started drafting rules on workplace heat dangers, and said the Labor Department will prioritize work inspections on days when the heat index surpasses 80 degrees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Workplace injuries caused by extreme heat are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/15/climate/heat-injuries.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">significantly undercounted</a> (by about 20,000/year in California alone), and extreme heat is the No. 1 weather-related killer in the country, according to the <a href="https://www.weather.gov/mkx/heatwaves?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">National Weather Service</a>.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

FROM THE CREW

</p>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking to make meaningful changes in your career? Morning Brew has you covered.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MB/A, our virtual 8-week program designed to accelerate the careers of top-performing professionals, is now accepting applications for our Winter Cohorts. style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The One True Winner of Squid Game\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSquid Game (Netflix)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s Netflix. The streaming service said it added 4.4 million net subscribers last quarter to top analyst predictions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompare that to a measly 5.5 million net subscribers for the entire first half of 2021, and it seems Netflix got its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/19/netflix-nflx-q3-2021-earnings.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emojo back\u003c/a\u003e after an awkward post-quarantine period.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe star of Netflix’s summer slate?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e. The gory Korean drama has become Netflix’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-17/squid-game-season-2-series-worth-900-million-to-netflix-so-far?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost popular show\u003c/a\u003e by far, with 142 million accounts tuning in within its first four weeks—demolishing runner-up \u003cem\u003eBridgerton\u003c/em\u003e’s lifetime viewership of 82 million by 73%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-17/squid-game-season-2-series-worth-900-million-to-netflix-so-far?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereportedly generated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $900 million in value, and it cost only about $21 million to make. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was also the No. 1 show in 94 different countries, showcasing Netflix’s extensive global reach.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix isn’t just looking beyond borders for new customers, but also to different mediums besides TV and movies. Specifically, video games. In yesterday’s shareholder letter, Netflix highlighted that it recently a) acquired video game developer Night School Studio and b) added games to its mobile app in Poland, Spain, and Italy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy?\u003c/strong\u003e Because the competition has never been fiercer.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eNetflix acknowledged that it competes with a “staggeringly large set of activities for consumers’ time and attention.\" Netflix said it recorded a 14% engagement boost when Facebook went down for several hours on Oct. 4.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut unrest is lurking beneath the surface. \u003c/strong\u003eSome Netflix employees will rally in front of the streamer’s LA headquarters this morning ahead of a planned virtual walkout today. The protest is the crest of a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/19/business/media/netflix-dave-chappelle-employee-walkout.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilding wave\u003c/a\u003e of backlash to Dave Chappelle’s standup special \u003cem\u003eThe Closer\u003c/em\u003e, a Netflix original show that critics say is transphobic.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/netflix-announces-better-than-expected-subscriber-growth\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Pfizer? FDA Says…\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/19/the-fda-could-approve-mixing-and-matching-vaccines?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Gif of people saying that both is good\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-19/image-1eaa7633584312595bef234cc4c16aaad2abb7ef-296x160-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker(24).gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether you were jabbed with Moderna, Pfizer, or another Covid-19 vaccine, you may soon be able to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/oct/19/covid-vaccine-booster-mix-johnson-and-johnson-pfizer-moderna-us?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswitch brands\u003c/a\u003e for your booster. The FDA could approve a mix-and-match strategy as early as tonight, when it’s expected to announce its authorization of Moderna and Johnson \u0026 Johnson boosters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMeet “heterologous prime-boost”\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot a Transformer. It’s the scientific term for receiving two different types of vaccines. The pandemic’s putting this strategy to the test, and so far, the results \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/19/health/covid-vaccine-mix-match.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare promising\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen Europe allowed young people who got AstraZeneca’s vaccine to switch to Pfizer for their second shots, their immune systems produced more antibodies than those who stuck with one type, researchers found.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA recent study of 50 volunteers found that people who received two J\u0026J shots saw their antibodies increase 4x, but those who switched to Pfizer for their boosters got a 35x power-up and a 76x boost from Moderna.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy?\u003c/strong\u003e Sparring against two different vaccine formulas may better prepare your immune system to fight the main boss, Covid-19.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eImmunity benefits aside, allowing patients to switch boosters could help speed up the distribution of vaccines.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBoardrooms of the S\u0026P Are Getting More Diverse\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the past year, US public companies have added the most diverse group of new directors ever, according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/newest-class-of-corporate-directors-is-the-most-diverse-yet-but-gains-are-uneven-11634644801?mod=hp_lead_pos12\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo new studies\u003c/a\u003e. Ethnic and racial minorities accounted for 47% of new directors compared to 22% the previous year, according to a study by executive search firm Spencer Stuart.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne-third of new directors added to corporate boards between May 2020 and May 2021 were Black, up from just 11% the year prior.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBoth studies show that more than one-third of S\u0026P 500 boards have three female directors, and roughly one-quarter of them have four. Just 10% of boards had four female directors in 2016.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe shifting makeup of boards comes as public companies face regulatory pressure to make their boards look more like America. In August, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nasdaqs-board-diversity-proposal-faces-sec-decision-11628242202?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSEC approved\u003c/a\u003e a rule that companies listing on the Nasdaq meet minimum diversity requirements for their boards, or explain why they missed those minimums. And a pair of recent \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-race-and-ethnicity-chris-holden-legislation-racial-injustice-60eab0f0c722c65802050179c23dd3c5?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCalifornia laws\u003c/a\u003e also established diversity requirements for public companies based in the state (though one of them is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/appeals-court-revives-challenge-to-california-law-mandating-women-board-members-11624317002?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efacing legal challenges\u003c/a\u003e).—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSeville, Spain, will become the first city in the world to begin naming and categorizing heat waves, similar to the system already in place for hurricanes. Kicking off in 2022, the plan is part of an increasing global effort to bring more attention to heat waves as an immediate threat and \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/record-shattering-heat-waves-becoming-far-more-likely-study-e13fde50-45d8-4bcd-bc86-efecba6c5217.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esymptom of climate change\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eClimate experts and public health officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/weather/2020/08/06/naming-heat-waves/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave said\u003c/a\u003e that naming heat waves could help make an invisible threat like heat more tangible, and allow local authorities to more easily communicate about and plan for them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US isn’t naming heat waves just yet, but the government is taking steps to address the dangerous effects heat has on workers (particularly, those in low-income groups).\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eFollowing the hottest summer \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-sets-a-summer-heat-record-this-year-11631229336?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon record\u003c/a\u003e, the Biden administration started drafting rules on workplace heat dangers, and said the Labor Department will prioritize work inspections on days when the heat index surpasses 80 degrees.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWorkplace injuries caused by extreme heat are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/15/climate/heat-injuries.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esignificantly undercounted\u003c/a\u003e (by about 20,000/year in California alone), and extreme heat is the No. 1 weather-related killer in the country, according to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.weather.gov/mkx/heatwaves?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\"
